text: The brown inca (Coeligena wilsoni), is a species of hummingbird. It is found in Colombia and Ecuador. Unlike most hummingbirds, the brown inca are not brightly colored. Instead they are plain brown with a white patch on the shoulder and an iridescent purple throat if seen in the best light. == References== * Database entry includes justification for why this species is of least concern. Category:Birds of South America Category:Hummingbirds
title: Brown inca
